text: Pours hazy mango into a shaker. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving scant sheets. Mango, pineapple and passion fruit aromas. Soft with resin and hay upfront turning to dry, warming sourdough and pineapple before the lasting mango and pith finish.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the Hill Farmstead tap takeover on 4/1/2017. Not an April Fools Joke. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of grassy notes, citrus, floral. Tastes of floral notes, grassy notes, citrus. Medium body with a dry finish.
Crazy good. The perfect combination of floral, citrus, and green. Long finish and nice body.

Mango and some passionfruit. Wonderful fruity head. Bitterness in aftertasteis pretty haedcore and lasting. Very good, and very bitter like the guys behind me at the Hill Farmstead when I skipped in line. Tapat Churchkey.

Aroma is wood, some earth, mild fruits and some nectar as well. Flavour is very similar, with a fresh crisp hoppy bite in the finish.

Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin white head. Pine nose, grass greeny notes, citrus lemon, a bit of floral as well. Taste is medium sweetness. Medium carbonation and medium bitterness. Body is light to medium. Very smooth mouthfeel. Very high drinkability, It is well balanced like all of their other IPAs.

Cloudy orange color. Medium-sized , white head. Beautiful aroma of tropical fruits and pine. Juicy, balanced taste. Strong but pleasant bitterness.Great IPA . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #18 Mega lekkie i aromatyczne, smakuje jak dobry American Wheat
Draft: Poured a hazy orange with white head. Aroma is light hops. Taste is light hops and grain. Refreshing but thin.

On tap at the brewery. Poured a very hazy golden with an off white head. Aroma of some bitter orange, pine, a touch of grass. Flavor follows, with a lot of bitter pine, some light citrus rind, and leading to a toffee biscuity yeasty finish. Similar to Edward in flavor profile with a touch more citrus to the palate that, in my estimation, makes it a little better. Still did not wow me like I hoped but certainly palatable enough.

Draft at Mudville 9 NYC. Pours a cloudy orange color with a light head. Taste is hoppy and super balanced. Almost a perfect drinking example of an IPA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a bright, slightly hazy orange with white head. A floral hop, tropical fruit, and pine aroma. A smooth beer with citrus, floral, fruits, spices and pine flavors. A light lingering bitter hoo aftertaste.

Pours a hazed orange-yellow color with a huge, fluffy white head.

Smells of dried orange peel, passionfruit, bright lemon pulp and lots of wet grass. This gets pleasantly accompanied by some water melon and wet hay, complimented by sugared bread crust. Produces a refreshing crispness, including a whiff of sweet ice bonbon atop of hand made lemonade - very nice on the nose.

Has a fantastic smooth mouthfeel, incredibly soft on the palate with a light body, producing a nice hop bite during the finish.

Tastes of lemon, white bread dough and a hop profile which turns frutier within each second. The hops bring kiwi, wet grass more lime and a mellow, sweet maltiness to the palate. The sweetness gets washed away during the finish by a late herbal dryness which inherits a powerful, slowly evolving lemon dryness, which stays on the tongue surprisingly long.

Very nice, supersmooth, light and crisp with a hoppy fruit profile, pleasantly accentuated by the malts, while turning utmost dry in the end. Very eventful and perfectly crafted, another impressive, thoughtfully balanced beer from this brewery, with a nice herbal addition.

On draft at Fools Gold. It pours a hazy orange color with a creamy off white head. The aroma is bright and fresh with lime and citrusy grapefruit. A little honey. The flavor has more of the citrusy lime and grapefruit with flowers. Fresh and bright with a citrus zest bitterness in the finish. Very light cookie, bread and honey-like maltiness is supportive of the hops. Really great.
Tap. Cloudy bright lemon orange. Circus, grapefruity hops, melon, and slight berry aromas. Flavor is same, but grassier and dryer. Medium soft body. Killer.

Draft at armsby abbey. Pours pineapple yellow with a thin white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing. Has some solid floral hops. Lots of flowers on the tongue. Has some residual bitterness on the finish which I quite like. It's a nice beer but I like the other beers I've had from them more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Torst, Brooklyn, 14.5.16.Hazy amber. Guava and a little citrus aroma, bitter, fruity, guava and a little pear in the mouth. Medium body, guava and a little citrus finish.

Wow...sublime. On tap for dessert after my second meal of the day at The Anchor. Cloudy tequila sunrise in the glass. Fine white head. Creamy orange Julius nose. Palate follows suit, but isnt overly sweet, but instead well balanced with a dry cracker counter. I continue finding notes. Super complex, down the rabbit hole kind of beer. Right on.

Lunch at the Anchor with BTL. Wonderfully clody. Thinner head with similar lacing. Body is upfront malty with lighter hop tone. Second half thins out nicely with a lemo zing layer. Creamy ant then mellow light elongated finish.
From tap. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, malt, mango, juicy and bitterness.
Hopfiger, trocken bitterer Antrunk. Hell würzig, moderat herb, trocken bleibend. Bitterer, eher wässriger Mittelteil. Okay. 10/9/9/9/8//9

Hazy, rich gold with a finger of frothy head. Aroma is of grapefruit, citrus, light pine. Taste is of grapefruit, pine, grass, lemon peel, peach. Medium body, medium-low bitterness that fades fairly quick.

Drank on tap (16 oz) at Three Penny Taproom in Montpelier, Vermont on September 27, 2016. Golden creamy honey, small head. Hoppy orange and pine cone aroma, light sourness. Hoppy sour orange, dry pine notes, nice citrus bitterness. A compliment to all Susans in this world, including my mom, a hop head!

Growler shared by jc1762. Thanks Jon! Poured a hazy golden color with a small very light off-white head. Aroma was light citrus notes, mild lemon. Juicy mild tropical fruit notes. Flavor was really tasty. Light sweetness, mild lemon, juicy mild tropical fruit finish. Tasty.

Aroma- hoppy
Appearance- cloudy, yellow
Taste- delicious. One of my favorite beers. Great balanced but slightly bitter hop profile. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at brewery. Pours hazy yellow with a smallish white head. Aroma is floral, lightly piney, and slightly bready. Taste is similar with light tropical fruit. Strong bitterness in the finish. Light body. Slightly above average carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.

(On tap @ Warpigs HF Day, Copenhagen, May 12 2016) Pours hazy orange-gold with a big cap of white froth that leaves lots of lace. Aroma is quite juicy and fruity, grapefruit and mango to the fore, pineapple, orange, guava, light dank and pine, light malt touches. Flavour is quite dry with impression of sweetness from fruity hops, mango, peach, orange, grapefruit, with light to medium bitterness with a little pine and leafy character, slight pith. Malt body is light with a touch of cracker. Crisp, mineral feel. Medium bodied, slightly below average carb. Beautiful balance, extremely high drinkability, good feel in the mouth. Lovely IPA.
great ipa. on tap at madison pour house. some lace. good balance. a sipper.smooth mouthfeel.
Draft at anchorage brewing, hazy yellow beer, creamy white head. Aroma is lychee, mango, hint of resin. Taste is mango, lychee, quava, resin. Palate is light, carbonation moderate.

Poured into a tulip on tap at Blackback. One of my favorites. Pours slightly hazy orange with a one finger white head. Aroma of orange zest, grapefruit, mango, and pine. Taste is more of the same, so much clean flavor, slightly sweet up front but has a nice dry finish. Love this beer.
Sample @ Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover, Warpigs. Hazy yellow body with a small white head. Hops, light malt, grapefruit, lemon, citrus. Bitter aftertaste. Solid beer.

On tap @ Hill Farmstead. Pours thick hazy orange golden with creamy off-white head. Aroma is earthy fresh hops; grapefruit, mandarin orange, and oak notes stand out. Taste is clean, smooth, lightly creamy pale malt; present but restrained sweetness, loads of fresh hops balance against the malt body perfectly. Not huge, just a super impressive beer.

Tap into a shaker showing unfiltered yellow with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows moderately intense notes of tropical fruit including mango, pineapple, and light hints of peach and guava. 

The palate is full bodied and highly carbonated. Strong notes of lemon and dried fruit without any sweetness. Finishes with a strong bitterness.

Where and how:  on tap at 3 Penny VT 
Aroma soft creamy front, mild citrus, touch of rhubarb. Creamy behind with mild tartness. 7+
 Appearance : 
Top: medium smaller cap, long lasting, left rings on glass.
Base: murky amber gold
Palate :  medium bodied, soft mid with mellow walls. Medium finish.
Taste: easy going, top accented with more aggression than most VT brews. Softer, bitter, creamy finish.
 Other notes  solid creation but not worth it its score.

Tap at mule bar. Pours hazy orange with tons of frothy head. Nose is fruity orange and pineapple. Flavours pineapple, grapefruit, mango, some pine. Taste med bitter light/medium sweet. So juicy! Full almost creamy body with medium carbonation and lasting bitterness.

Courtesy of Darshan
Growler: The aroma consists of moderate tropical fruits, orange, grapefruit, and dank hops. It pours a hazy/cloudy dull orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with moderate tropical fruits and pineapple. The finish has light-moderate orange, grapefruit, and lemon peel. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.
On tap @ CBC-16. Cloudy yellow with a heavy white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt and bitterness. Medium body with a nice bitter / fruity finish.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Susan ].Hazy medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, tropical fruit, grapefruit, pale malt, citrus, mango - peach, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Super balanced ;D [20160512]

750 mL flip top cracked open by ebone1988 just because. The pour is a dirty golden orange color with a thick and chunky white head that roils down to a film and thick collar, leaving some huge lacing behind. The aroma is great. There is a lot of dank juiciness that is really good. The hops are light but well balanced throughout. This should be good as hell. Dank and juicy with a light hop. The flavor is not as good. There is a juicy hop, but the bitterness is overpowering. Its a strange mix. There is a light sweetness on the back end that is definitely hop related. There is no maltiness in this. Its all juicy hop and a touch of leafiness. The mouth feel is a little thicker than I want it, but the carbonation is excellent. There is a leafy bright juicy hop that lasts and lasts. I dig it.

750 flip top growler shared with koleminer20. Aroma is juicy, tropical fruit, pine, citrus, good lord. Appearance is ugly, hazy as fuck, golden amber, white head. Taste is grassy, citrus, slightly juicy, bitter pine, delicious. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, bitter pine aftertaste. Overall, really really good stuff here.

Tap at CBC 2016, red session. Hazy orange with white head. Hoppy. Aroma of citrus, pine and tropical fruits. Malty backbone. The flavour is mainly bitter but some sweetness too. Balanced. Light and juicy, A good one...

Thought Id finally rate this one... Growler at home into HF tulip. Pours a very hazy orange color with an inch of white head. Smells of citrus and ripe tropical fruit, slight dank notes underneath. Taste has juicy fruit up front followed by a moderate, clean bitterness. Body is medium; texture is a bit thin; carbonation is soft and pillowy. Lightly bitter finish.
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Red session 20160514. Hoppy, fruity and citrusy with grapefruits and pine needles. The finish is dry and hoppy.
Augur Wells, NYC. Cloudy grapefruit, creamy head. Slight funk hop, rich, earthy funk and a bit of citrus. Solid.

Passionfruit, pineapple, grapefruit, resin, pure hop juice, lovely and aromatic.
Hazy Golden colour, medium white head, lacing.
Big assertive bite, mid-sweet, lots of grapefruit, but also pine and pineapple in the taste.
Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish.

Tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Hazy blonde with a thin white cap. Lemon and tangerine hoppy nose. Mixed fruity taste, white grape, herbal, juicy, quenching. Has a bit of most IPA things going on, but not the best one I ever had.
On tap at CBC 2016, day 2. Bright yellow with a white head. Citrus hops and honey, smooth mouthfeel, a nice assortment of tropical fruit notes in the background.

On tap at WarPigs Brewpub, Hill Farmstead Day. Kindly shared by KimJohansen . Dissipating white head leaving crocheted lacing behind. Hazy golden-orange coloured body. Inviting, fresh floral and fruity hopped aromas. Hopped fruity flavours as well, fine mixed cocktail of grapefruit, orange, mango and apricot followed by citrus peels to the finish. Smooth on the swallow. Very well made version of the style (Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

Aroma and taste is an explosion of juicy tropical and citrus fruits, big mango, grapefruit, mandarin, pine needles, nice light malt backing, goes down an absolute treat, wonderful.

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Hazy yellow with a white head. Fresh with hops, grapefruit, citrus, mango and some pine. Nicely balanced with a rather light body. Refreshing and nicely drinkable. Please, send Susan one to Sweden. I would take good care of her.
Sample at cbc. Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is hoppy, Nice Balance. Taste is hoppy, fruity, grapefruit.

750ml growler pours cloudy opaque pale orange with a tight finger of head. Nose is pineapple, tropical, mango, peach, melon, juicy cotrus. Taste is bright juicy orange peel, balanced medium bitterness, light doughy grain, grapefruit, crisp, tropical, dry. Finishes with medium-strong clean and tight bitterness, assorted citrus zest, pithy grapefruit, tropical, light dry malt. Wonderful.
Sample CBC-16, Copenhagen 14/5-16. Hoppy and fruity with grapefruit. Dry and bitter finish.

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
Small creamy shortlasting head, hazy. Aroma is slightly fresh foresty, leafs, moss, pine needles, lawn, hops, hay, flowers, light malts, citrus, dried fruits. Taste is dry foresty, moss, pine needles, bark, leafs, hops, lawn, hay, light malts, minerals, paper, citrus peel. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Tap @ CBC -16. Cloudy pale golden with a small white top. aroma of tropial fruits, melon, mango and some citrus. taste is bitter with pine and resin. dry finish. another really good one from Hill Farmstead. medium body and avg co2

Draught at @Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Hazy deep hay yellow liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of tangerine, citrus, fresh hops, grain, grapefruit and light weed. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great.

Tap at CBC. Pours cloudy golden with fluffy white head. Hoppy mango, passionfruit, pine, peach. Very good malt base.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample @ cbc 2016. Pours a hazy golden colour beer with a medium head. Piney and hoppy with a fruity mouth. Dry finish

Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of super fresh and juicy fruits, citrus, zesty grapefruit and tropical notes. Taste is super fresh, fruity juicy and citrusy with some zesty grapefruit and biscuity malty backbone. Finish is crisp, citrusy and fresh hoppy with some juicy fruits. An awesome IPA.
From tap at CBC 2016. It pours hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma is quite fruity. Peach and light passion fruit. Peach and passion fruit with malty notes in the flavor. A bit watery.
Tap at war pigs... Hazy Amber... Thin white lacing.. Sweet floral fruit nose... Juicy sweet floral orange peach ... Juicy fruit.. Zezty orange apricot... Summer fruit.. Long bitter linger

Tap @Warpigs. Hazy orange, thick white head. Peach, pineapple and light grapefruit aroma. Similar flavour, very fruity. Lasting, fresh bitterness with som light and smooth biscuit. Seriously drinkable.

Tap@ warpigs. Pours golden hazy, thick white head. Oily hoppy fresh aroma, tropical fruits. Massive fruits really. Flavor has sweetness, fruity hops, pineapples, mango, resin. Piny finish. Fresh, awesome stuff.

Piney, juicy fruity hoppy nose. Med light bodied, surprisingly light, bitter finish, cream malty tropical fruity. Really nice. Easy, tad bitter dry finish tho. Feels sessionable.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Light hazy golden pour with a generous head. Super juicy hops, light lingering bitterness, tons of tropical fruits, stone fruits, smooth and refreshing!

Draft to snifter at Prohibition Pig. Looks good; a cloudy pineapply orange with foamy eggshell head. Smells good too; loads of juicy hops alongside a moderately bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly juice-like medium-bodied mouthfeel. Delicious.

On tap at the Pony Bar in NYC. Pours a hazy golden with a white head and very pleasant hoppy, citrus aroma. Taste is full of flavor, lots of citrus, hops, grapefruit, and pine into the dry, bitter finish. Very drinkable and delicious IPA

With Z , late Sunday night at the Piny Bar, Midtown , Manhattan, pours a hazy lemon color . Nose is full of a deep citrus fragrance with lemon, peaches and tropical fruits . Taste is all citrus with softer pine and resin, and a perfectly balanced bitter sweetness. Finish is bittersweet, and ends o the same tasting notes with a moderately long finish. Does not get much better than this . Quaff Scire 9 / 10

La soeur dEdward cette IPA classique dHill Farmstead est tout en équilibre. Du haut de sa couleur orangée, on perçoit un peu de tout au nez et en bouche : Des agrumes, de lamertume, du houblon, mais rien qui se démarque. Cest drôlement bien équilibré. Mais rien qui se démarque réellement non plus.

Drucken på fat på Mikkeller&Friends. Gyllengul, rejält disig, högt vitt skum. Fantastisk doft med massor av fruktighet, aprikoser, ananas, papaya, passionsfrukt, mango och citrus men också bra maltprofil bakom frukten. Smaken är riktigt bra. Fruktigheten står sig riktigt bra trots en rejäl beska. En riktigt mjuk stor och fin kropp håller ihop smakerna bra. Jag skulle kanske ha skruvat ned beskan någon men det är det enda jag kan anmärka. Kanske den bästa IPA jag någonsin druckit.
Aroma is standard ipa, yellow hazy beer with White head. Taste is light sweetness heavy bitterness. Dry long finish mediumlight body. Tasty ipa. Between double citra and society.
Tap at mikkeller&friends, copenhagen. Hazy orange color, white head. Tempting aroma has mango, grapefruit, other fruits. Nice crispy hoppy taste, mango, grapefruit. Balanced and tasty.

Pours murky orangish amber with white head. Smell is mango, dank hops, tropical fruit and pine. Taste is mango, earthy hops, tropical fruit aand hints of crisp malt on finish. Juicy stuff. Medium body, medium carb.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of herbal, dank hops, weed, citrus, mango, pineapple. Taste is citrussy, herbal, dank, mango, pineapple, minty-like fresh hops, subtle resin. Wow!

pour orange with a fine white head. light piny aroma and lots of exotic fruit. well balanced taste with a medium bitterness, and very light sweetness. medium bodied, with an average carbonation. light bitter finish

08-APR-2016, draft @Mikkeller & Friends, side-by-side with Harlan.
Very hazy golden and slightly darker than Harlan.
A huge fluffy, lasting, lacing, White head.
Aroma is grape fruit, over ripe fruit, exotic fruit, flowers. Taste is peach, grape fruit, caramel, flowers. Bitter and bitter finish. Thin body, soft carbonation. A Little more tasty than Harlan.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Victoriagade. Cloudy golden with an amber tint. Thin, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus fruits, grasses, peaches, spicy hints, caramel malts, bitter fruits. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and pale malts, a herbal spicy note. Excellent IPA.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of herbal, fruity, citrus hops. Hazy golden amber with white head lasting. Taste is heavy bitterness, light sweetness. Full body, oily texture, light carb., great lasting bitter finish.

Hazy dark straw colour with a semi dense white head. Nose is sweet and bitter at the same time. Very tropical and fruity. Taste has full flavours but still feels light. Full on herbal, dank hops. Lightly bitter aftertaste. Very long lasting aftertaste. Thought this was great

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours a hazy orangy with a big, lasting, white head. Aroma is surprisingly malty, light bread, some caramel, medium sweet. But also lots of tropical fruits, some grass, piny. Taste is somewhat sweet, but with a pretty high, spicy hoppy bitterness. High carbonation and a semi-oily body.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, hop spice, grapefruit, mango, oranges, caramel and floral. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet. Medium bodied, oily texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is dry, pleasant bitterness and sweet.

duft: frisk sødlig frisk frugtig appelsin lidt rød frugt lidt alle jordbær.
smag: frisk frugt super juice meget bitterhed ellers blød og rund i smagen
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Barcelona. Hazy orange colour with white head. Tropical fruits and pineapple aroma. Sweet, tropical fruits, pineapple and peach taste. Medium body.

Tap. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus, flowery and earthy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice IPA but a little disappointing. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Golden hazy with white head. Floral aroma, citrus, grass, perhaps a hint of chasew nuts. Taste is floral as well with notes of grapefruit, earthly, hops, fruits. Full body, oily texture, fizzy carbonation.

Keg. Unclear orange with a medium sized white head. Citrus, flowers, wood, light earthy, minerals, light sugar. Medium body, oily texture, fine carbonation. Some initial sweetness until the bitterness comes though into a long dry finish. Drinks well and I enjoy it more and more after each sip.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Unclear dark yellow/orange with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, peach, pineapple and earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, peach, earthy, little sweet, tropical fruit and medium bitter.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Unclear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 070416

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours cloudy dark yellow with a white head, light lacings. Aroma of malt, light sweetness, sweet fruity hops, peach, light citrus, orangepeel, grapefruit. Flavor is light sweet, malt, rich sweet fruity hops, tropical fruit, grassy, citrus. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 070416

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, bitter hops and malt. Nice long bitter finish.
Tap at Monks. Cloudy yellow with lacy white head. Big time pine and juicy hop aroma. Harsh bite up front but short impact once the sweetness from the hop juice kicks in.

Growler. Pours orange with a White head. Aroma of orange, tropical, juicy, pineapple, grape bitternes. Taste is Extreme dry, tropical, mango, smooth crips, light resin. Extreme balanced, very dry if you let i linge. Bitter as hell. Nice

Ah, sweet mystery of beer, at last I drank you♬ Pours a lovely cloudy bright orange with a large creamy white head. Aroma is fresh citrus, pine, mango, pineapple and clean sweet malts. Taste is a sensational combination of fresh juicy citrus, tropical fruits, pine, peaches and mango. It truly tastes as good as it looks!

Fantastic initial big juicy hop aroma, fades a bit over time but started huge initially. Very tropical mango hop aroma. Taste brings in much more piney resinous hops, the tropical mango is still there but it takes a backseat to the piney hops. Malt is on the light side and it lets the hops shine. Really well done ipa. I wanted more of the tropical hops to come through the flavor and was slightly bummed when the piney hops "won" (I would say 80-20 piney to tropical hops in the flavor). But if piney is your thing this is fantastic. And really is just a well made beer. I wanted to drop it a bit from where I rated it just because I am not a huge piney resinous hop fan, but this is just so well made and "balanced" I could not justify dropping any part of my rating. I say "balanced" because it is a hop bomb, but showcases the hops so well it feels balanced. Just well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the Pony Bar NYC. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Smells citrus, fresh fruity hoppy, Tastes fresh fruity hoppy, woody with a clear bitter finish.

750 ml growler, 3 weeks old, shared with friends at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, from trade with Frank. Light hazy yellow golden color with white to off white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, citrusy fruity, tropical fruits, grassy, light pine, light caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma with some more caramel and bread notes. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Draft at Tria Taproom. Cloudy orange pour with a large frothy white head. Thick lace. Complex mix of earthy floral hops. Juicy but very dry. Green oranges. Lots of wood tannins. Autumn leaves. Chanterelles. Bruised stone fruit. Nectarines. Apricots. Peaches. Dry florals. Sage. Dandelions. Easy drinking but not slight. Great!

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2016 Growler @ RBWG 2016. Hazed/turbid orange beer with a fluffy white head. Juicy melon, orange, and grapefruit on the nose. Plenty of peach, too. Slight biscuit malt and a nice body and mouthfeel to it. Good bitterness, though relatively mild. Slight sweetness of tangerine and orange. Bitter pine, grass, and grapefruit finish. Solid!

Draft; Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of floral hops, some hay/grain, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, wet floral hops, and citrus; Finish is crisp and fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Somewhat mild aroma - but very good nonetheless.

APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: fruity, hoppy, fresh.
TASTE: about the same, quite nicely balanced.
Draft. Faint aroma of orange juice. Flavors are of orange, even marmalade and graham cracker. Solid, unspectacular.

Tap at Reservoir, Waterbury. Colour is very cloudy orange with small thick white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, tropical fruits, hops and malts. Very much fruitiness with harsh body and nice gentle hops.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Pours cloudy bright orange with a foamy two finger white head with amazing lacing. Aroma is of fresh citrus juice, juicy tropical fruits (pineapple and mango), melon, strawberries, pine resin, grassy and herbal hops, light bready malts, and light sweet malts. Taste is fresh citrus (a lot of grapefruit), juicy tropical fruits, pine resin, freshly cut grass, and some light bready malts in the background. Has a medium body with a super creamy, soft mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long, lingering finish. Overall, a amazing, worldclass, super tasty and complex IPA that is my favorite of the style and probably my 2nd favorite beer ever after Pliney The Younger.

[1/30/16] Growler sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Cloudy golden. Fruity hops. Dry, kinda juicy.

Draft at Good Beer, 2/5/16. Aroma crosses through all the hop tropes, with tropical notes, pine/resin, spice, earth, and even a hint of grass. Flavor is much the same, solidly bitter. It is slightly heavy on the carbonation but has a pretty good overall mouthfeel. Not the best thing Ive ever had from Hill Farmstead, but still pretty stellar.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Growler at the Rate Beer Awards Festival Bottle Share. Dank-ass nose of grapefruit, diesel, lemon, orange. Rich, malty grapefruit and dank flavors, nice bitterness. Very good.

From notes (11/21/15). An amazing IPA with a ton of well chosen hops. It all blends together to make a "greatest hits" of modern American IPAs -- grapefruit and orange juice, a fair amount of pine, and some floral notes too.

On tap at Armsby Abbey, Woosta. A trip to Worcester has saved me an all day drive to Northern Vermont to sample some HF brews. Great stuff. Visually lovely even in the under-lit Abbey. Clean, fresh flavor and aroma, a burst of citrus and hops with a very nice malt background and the mildest bitterness. Very well balanced, easy drinking... a very classy IPA.
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 A: Cloudy deep orange/brown coloured with a white head. N: Hoppy, fruity nose. T: Very nice hoppiness to it! Grass, hay. O: Excellent!

Glowing light orange with a big white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, apricot and mango. Taste quite juicy of tropical fruits with a restrained bitterness, nice mouthfeel. Had this blind next to PseudoSue & Zeelander, at this landed at the bottom.

On tap 12/22/15. Pours a hazy dark straw with a fluffy white head. Nose citrus, melon, tropical, yummy. Taste is the same. Lots of melon, lemon, grass, tropical. Super fluffy. Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased growler at brewery after sons ski meet in next-door Craftsbury. Pours a frothy, thin head with golden-yellow color. Citrus and bread aromas but piney-citrus taste dominates. Medium-light carbonation with grapefruit peel aftertaste. One of best beers Ive had since summer.

On tap at Hill Farmstead. A yellow-orange colored beer topped by a creamy, off-white head of fingerthick size. Grapefruity aroma with resins and a touch of pale malts. Perhaps a bit low on bitterness, but with a good grapefruity, resiny hoppy flavor on a lightly bready malt backdrop. Medium to full body and a nice carbonation level. Mostly fruity lasting finish. Quenching and quite tasteful. 150610

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2015 Pours cloudy pale golden color with white head. Aroma is grapefruit, peaches, and mango. Slight oily mouthfeel. Flavor is juicy grapefruit, fresh peaches and mangos. Finishes with grapefruit and dank pine resin. A truly amazing brew.

From a growler, picked up at the brewery. Murky gold. Messy, sticky, milky white head. Big fresh hop to this. Notes of peach. Tinned pear. Lychee. Soft, creamy malts. Very luscious. Taste has a nice balance of juicy sweetness and light, pithy bitterness. Creamy palate. Has definite body to it. Soft chew. Finishes long, soft, rising bitter. Lovely.

750 mL growler. Unknown original review date.

Hazy golden yellow. Small white head. Wispy surface.

Smell is tons of simcoe. Deeper whiff reveals mango and tropical fruits. I dont love simcoe, but this smells great.

Taste is all hops. Simcoey grapefruit at first. Grainy cracker malt. Switches dramatically to citra-like hop flavors in the finish. Tastes like mangoes in the end.

Light. Well carbonated and a touch of bitterness.

It takes a lot for a simcoe IPA to win me over, but this did.
Hazy golden pour on draft. Some lingering white head. Aroma is oranges and some grapefruit. Flavor is albout citrus. This is great. I love HFS.

Had to have another quick brew once I saw this was on tap at Bacchus. Cloudy orange pour with nose of citrus and dank hops. Tastes of grapefruit rind, resinous hops, peach, floral, slightly herbal. Sticky fun palate. Very bitter amd delightful.

Beautiful apricot gold pour, small white head. Aroma of pine, grass, citrus, bread. Taste follows, sweet yet quite bitter, with bready and spicy malts,and a bit of soap. Medium body, long bitter finish.

Growler rapporté à la maison. La photo illustre parfaitement ce produit magnifique. Au nez, je respire les arômes du plus grand bol de salade de fruits qui soit: de la mangue, de lannana à profusion, de la pêche blanche, du kiwi, de la fraise. Dieu que ça sent bon!!!! Une touche maltée supporte magnifiquement le tout. Un bouquet darômes comme on en hume que très rarement. En bouche le liquide affiche des saveurs plus subtiles et moins éclatantes que ce à quoi je mattendais. Une attaque en dry hop des plus intéressantes qui punch fort mais qui est rapidement passée. Beaucoup dagrumes circulent dans ma bouche tels un suprême doranges et du pamplemousse. Une amertume parfaitement balancée aux saveurs de fruits tropicaux libérés par les houblons. Une magnifique IPA!
Pours a light gold with white head. Aroma of pine citrus and yeast. Wonderful pine flavors. Finishes amazingly smooth.

Draft at Black Back Pub. Pours a mostly clear light golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma is on point! Quite unique. Cant even describe it. Flavor backs off a bit, but still fantastic. Piney. A wonderful beer.
Growler. Lightly clouded golden, light tan head. Crisp pine, light citrus. Lightly bitter, quite dry. Light body, very clean, moderate length finish. Excellent.

750ml growler from the brewery bought today. Aroma: tropical fruits, oranges pines, a tad of caramel. App: hazy golden with medium to thick white head leaving awesome lacing. Taste and palate: awesome mouthfeel! This is fruity, smooth, velvety with a moderate carbonation, resinous, medium long bitter finish. Overall: my palate was literally pet by the texture of this beer. This isn?t harsh at all, which I liked a lot. This is so enjoyable! Please don?t tell my wife but I love another woman. I love you Susan! This is pure love in a bottle!

Draught @ John Brown Smokehouse. Hazy dark orange with medium sized spongy white head, floral hops aroma, low carbonation, very well balanced hoppy taste that starts sweetish, medium hoppy finish. Incredibly well balanced hoppiness.
Draft from blind tiger. Cloudy bright orange yellow pour. Cloudy foam head. Not overpowered and beautiful balance. The saison of ipa.

On tap at the brewery, multiple times at various Burlington and Waterbury establishments because it was so yummy. Opaque amber with a creamy head. Amazingly fresh tropical fruit hop aroma with some peach and grass, moderate carbonation and full bodied, easy to drink with a long complex, slightly dry finish, love the moderate alcohol percentage yet huge complexity, would gladly sip on this all summer (heck all year) long.
Growler, thanks to Alex and Pontus. Clear golden beer with an small offwhite head. Hoppy tropical fruit caramell hay aroma. Hoppy spicy hay fruity citrus caramell flavour.

Pretty golden orange pour with one finger of offwhite head. Nose shows some lightly woody notes, citrus, peach, and various fruits/tropical notes. Lots of fruit and juicy notes in the flavor with a citrus rind and woody follow up. Medium light body with a soft finish.

On tap at Three Penny Taproom in Montpelier VT. 
Pours a hazy, orange-amber. Huge pillowy white head. Nose is bold sweet malt with mango notes. Taste is nicely balanced. Malt is pronounced, but hop notes keep up. Very nice! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Growler Garage.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a nice looking hazy bronzed orange color with a bar pours kind of slim white head that dissipated within less than a minute leaving some messy lacing.
The smell started off with some sweet peach, light apricots, light pine blend bittersweet and sound off together really nicely.
The taste was bittersweet all of the way through in the previously mentioned flavors running into a nice semi-sweet to bitter citrus aftertaste.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice bittersweet feel on my tongue. Sessionable enough to want to have with food.
Overall, Id have this again. Its pretty good.
Growler. Pours clear amber with a nice off white head. Aroma is grassy hoppy piny citric a bit sweet. Flavor is as aroma, solid HF, clean flavorful fruity bitterness well balanced.
Draft in tulip. Very hazy goldish orange with a short white head. Aroma is citrus, grass, and yeast. Lemon, grapefruit, honey, pine.  Just a little funkiness.
Hazy gold pour. Aroma mild hops. Tastes mild hops. This was very light tasting for a supposedly hoppy brew. There are better hill beers.

I'm not an IPA person, but I can respect it when it's done well. And this is most definitely done well.

Sample pour at the source. Pours a cloudy gold with a foamy white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, some grass. Flavor nicely of peach, mango, and some grass notes. Medium body, thick texture and solid carbonation. Mildly bitter to finish. Amazing.

Bottle sample @ The Stein & Vine, Brandon. Thanks Ty!
Dorée-orangée, pas de col.
Arôme offre une superbe profondeur des houblons, fleuri à souhait, résineux, rappelant un Simcoe et Amarillo. Malt reste en retrait.
Palais est malté léger, sur un houblonné vert très frais avec un renforcement houblonné rappelant les pellettes. Houblonnage à cru? fini est sec légèrement poudreux, et les houblons sont tous simplement divin.
Several pours out of a growler. Poured a hazy golden color with a smaller sized head. Juicy. Fruity, pine, and citrus. I could drink this all day and every day long.

Shred growler at Craft Ale House beer share. Turbid gold pour with white head. Nose was that classic piney and tropical fruity, juicy hop nose. Tasted hoppy, with layered tropical citrus, some funk, spice, and amazing complexity.

on tap at Abbye in Worcester. Pours a messy brownish hazy murky color. Two inches of fuzzy head. Great grape and peach aroma. mouthfeel is light and smooth. Taste is extremely well balanced with zero bittnerness. Slightly creamy, probably due to the fact that its not filtered. Lots of peachy mango with other light flavors. Really, really good.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Pours a hazy orange with a dense white lacing. The aroma is orange forward followed by grapefruit and other citrus notes. There is some booze towards the end. The flavor is bitter and the palate finishes somewhat dry.
Split with Jredmond and dickinsonbeer. Fuzzy peach flesh nose. Pours a hazy gold. Fruity taste very light with no bitterness.
UPDATED: JUL 17, 2016 On tap at Blackback Pub. Amazing tropical fruit aroma. Silky smooth tropical hops in the taste, creeping bitter finish. American ipa perfection.

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Brewery, Greensboro, VT
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine, grass and peach. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grape, piney and grassy finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Sampled at the brewery. Yellow pour, white head. Crisp grassy hops on the nose. Flavor is assertive bitter and dry with nice citrus and grass notes. Super crisp, very light tropical fruit sweetness. Good stuff.

Growler from brewery. Cloudy golden orange with big white head. Lots of big pungent citrusy hops - fruity and complex, can keep going in for more. Taste is sweet and lots of citrus, slightly sweet but lots of orange, mango, lemon. Just terrific.

Fresh 750 ml growler pours hazy pale yellow with a white one finger head. Juicy Aromas of fresh citrus and a hint of pine. Taste mimics the aroma with a semi dry mouth feel and nice balanced hop finish. Exceptional beer.
Slightly hazy pale yellow pour. Slight white head. Mild nose. Big hoppy goodness in the taste. Citrus, a hint of pine, some earthy spices too. Very nice.

Fresh 750 ml growler supplied by Willrunforbeer, much thanks! Pale yellow in color with lasting head retention in the snifter. Holy hell this smells great! Grapefruit, tropical fruits with a mild grain hint. Citra hops in bloom? 
The flavor mimics the aroma with a dry texture over the tongue. Bitterness is on the low side but BIG of flavor. This drinks like a DIPA but with the lower ABV, bitterness is lasting after the sip. Exceptional well balanced IPA with just enough malt backing. Damn this is refreshing!

En fût. Couleur jaune paille trouble, mousse blanche crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de houblon fruité, agrumes, écorce de pamplemousse. Goût de houblon résineux, agrumes, malt, citron, écorce de pomélo en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen, crémeux.

750ml growler. Hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are bread, honey, peach, pineapple, orange and pine resin with floral and herbal notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Growler fill at the brewery 03/27/15. Pours hazy yellow golden grapefruit color small white head. Aroma is strong pineapple, mango, tropical fruits, light malt backbone, resin . Flavor is piney, resinous, hop bitterness, tropical fruits. Very good. Exceptional IPA, but not as balanced as I expected.

Robe orange foncée, très trouble. Un généreux col de mousse se forme et se dissipe tranquillement pour ne laisser quun mince voile. Très fines bulles, effervescence moyenne et généreuse dentelle. Les arômes sont envoutantes. Très frais, orange, mandarine, pamplemousse gorgé de sucre. Un petit côté résineux tente de faire sa place aux milieu de ce cocktail tropical. En bouche, tout aussi sublime. Les saveurs fruitées des arômes prennent le dessus rapidement pour envelopper le palais de leur amertume et exotisme. La finale, plus amère, ouvre la porte à des effluves rappelant les grains de céréales. Le liquide est frais, léger, goûteux et on a encore une fois ce sentiment de regret de ne pas en avoir acheté dautres, comme cest souvent le cas avec les produits de HF.

From the growler. Beautiful looking beer. Aroma is a citrus hop explosion....all the orange and yellow fruits, with some bready yeast. Taste is lemon zest, orange peel, berries, little grass, and pine. Somewhat bitter finish, not overpowering, light mouthful, sticky, and dry. World class. Yum!

5/III/15 - 75cl growler @ Drunken Drivers tasting (home) - BB: n/a, filled: 3/III/15 (2015-264) Thanks to AdamJackson for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, small creamy yellowish head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of citrus, piny, resinous, bit fruity, passion fruit and grapefruit. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus, lots of it, piny, bit resinous, lots of fruity notes. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, grapefruit, bit piny, nice bitterness, pineapple, fruity in general. Lovely beer this one!

On tap at three penny. Pours hazy golden orange, hazy, thin white head that leaves a pinch of retention. Very pine forward, some citrus, light bitterness begins the sip but grows quite large through finish. Body is light to medium with a long drying finish.
Growler, pours is cloudy pale orange, aroma is citrus, melon, and grassy pine. Taste is perfectly balanced and a dry bitter finish, probably my favorite HF IPA so far.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Pours a really cloudy yellow, almost murky, with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of oranges, pine and slight alcohol. Taste is of soft wheat, oranges and moderately bitter. Nice cereal profile, makes it really smooth and easy drinking. Body is medium, carbonation as well and it is lightly sticky. Bitterness lingers for a good duration. Sunshine in a glass!

Can at Drunken Drivers Tasting @ tderoecks place. Thanks guys. Thanks alot to Adam for driving all the way over to let us taste some fresh IPA. CLoudy yellow, dark yellow. Piney, hopey, bitter. Everything an IPA should be. And as Tim said it, this is what you crave for when dreaming about a really good IPA.

Growler filled about a week and a half ago. Pours hazy orange, almost marigold, with one finger of large-bubbled off-white head that settles into a nice layer of lacing. Aroma is aromatic and spicy tropical fruit with dank Nelson-like notes of weed, mountain herbs, papaya, mango, durian, starfruit, peach, and riesling. Just out of control how good this smells  more or less perfect for those who like the Southern Hemisphere profile. Taste is silky mango and orange juice with some prominent white grape notes and somewhat more hard to pin down lychee-like notes, but less syrupy than most IPAs that are this fruity. Instead the second impression, after the initial tastes, is one of crispness and the pale malt base showing through with remarkable balance. Texture is impressive: silky but gulpable. I recall this beer being a favorite when I first had it, in my pre-RB days, at Blackback, and now Ill say it again: maybe my favorite Shaun Hill IPA for its tremendous balance of aromatics, boldness of flavor, crispness, and "drinkability." Love it.
Belle couleur dorée avec un col blanc mousseux. Aromes dagrumes, surtout de pamplemousse, un peu de résine, bien équilibré avec une amertume controlé. Une bonne IPA!

Growler from Kirk. Appearance is cloudy gold with light white head. Aroma is citrus, light floral, and pine. Taste is light citrus, followed by a mild burst of floral bitterness, finishes clean and very crisp. Very drinkable, and extremely well balanced, excellent IPA.

Northeast Bucket List Trip Beer #102. Keg at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange with a large creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of muted floral hops, mild earth, pale doughy malt. The taste is citrus, tropical, pineapple hops, doughy malt.
Draft. Hazy gold with little head Citrusy, dank and piney. Spritzy mouthfeel. Very good.

Growler from the brewery. Cloudy dark yellow gold. Lemon and citrus resin. Clean and refreshing. Excellent.

On tap at HF. Poured pale gold hazy with white head. Aroma mikd sweet citrus resin. Light carb med bod. Bitter dry taste that bites.

From a growler, consumed a couple of hours after fill. Hazy dirty blonde with a generous white head. Gentle citrus aromas with some mild flowery hops présence. Nice carbonation, crisp palate, very smooth bitterness, very far from a hop bomb with a superior drinkability. So easy drinking. Very nice sessionable IPA.

Growler from Hill Farmstead. Pours a bright yellow-gold, nice frothy white head that slowly fades to a cap. Nice moderate carbonation. Aromas of fresh citrus, flowers, sweet resins and a slight pine. Taste is a nice harmony of fresh squeezed oranges, lemon-lime and light malt sweetness before a nice bitter backbone finishes this off with a nice and dry grapefruit note. Really nice IPA!

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2016 July 16, 2015. On tap at Hill Farmstead.
Updated score.
October 10, 2014. On tap at M&F. 
Hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is juicy tropical fruits, peach, pineapple, citrus, pine, biscuit.Taste is to medium sweet biscuit and tropical fruits, smooth medium bitterness. Finish is light sweet apricots, stone fruits and grassy pine bitterness. Medium bodied. 
8-4-8-4-16=40
Draft at HF. This is getting very high ratings, but I didnt see it somehow. I thought it was a fairly yeasty, saison-like IPA, with some grassy hops. All right.
Draught at MikkellerBar. Cloudy golden - white head. Fresh hoppy. Ok bitterness. Citrus. Fruity. Bitterness. Light herbal. Light yeasty notes. Soapy.

Beau verre de soleil, dorange, de tangerine, de pêche, de fruits japonais et dananas avec des herbes et des aiguilles qui piquent sur un fond céréalier qui craque à chaque inspiration. Saveurs juteuses, fruitées, vitaminées, vertes, campagnardes et épicées. Superbe présence en bouche. Quel beau travail! Arrière-goût fantastique avec une solide présence de pamplemousse et de fleurs. Aromatique, houblons ajustés à merveille, jamais agressive, excessivement facile à boire. Totalement éclatante.

Growler from Leighton. Pours a cloudy pale golden orange, light white head. Aroma of tangerine, melon, fresh grass, pine, biscuit, fresh bread, pine. Flavor is light sweet into prime pine grassy bitter hop. Light / med body and good carbo.

Draught @ mikkeller. Orange coloured. Unclear. Dense off White head. Aroma. Citrus, grape, herbs, flowers, some sweetness. Flavour. Tropical fruits, herbs, flowers, sweetness, citrus. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter and citric.
Orange pour, foamy white head. Nose is fresh water, onion, grapefruit. Taste is onion, well water, citrus fruits, bitter clean finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy orange amber with a white head. Aroma is fresh hop forward with lots of dankness, grapefruit, herbs, mandarin mango and citrus fruits. Just a stunningly good aroma. The taste has those same tropical and citrusy fruits, also a slightly mint-feel and some lemon peel. So refreshing and drinkable. Wop!

On tap at Hill Farmstead tap takeover, Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade October 10th. Pours a cloudy peach with a low white head. Aromas of citrus apricot, peach and some pine notes. Very clear and nuanced aroma profile. Taste is citrus, apricot, peach, resin and some honey notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. By far the best IPA Ive had - blows everything else out of the water!

Aroma is focused on citrus hops, bold mango and grapefruit jump out of the glass, some pine and resin. Nice malt in the nose as well, bread, some toast, and notes of honey. Pours hazy golden, thick white head has good retention and laces nicely. Flavor is a fantastic balance of hops and malt. Big burst of hops, lots dank grapefruit and tropical fruit, bitterness is high up front but integrates nicely as the malt flavors come in. Honey and biscuit malt meld well with the hop charge. Medium body and carbonation, smooth and drinkable. Excellent.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity grapefruit hoppy weak peachy aroma. Fruity malty grapefruit hoppy bitter peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

Tap at MIkkeller & Friends. Aroma has some citrus, hops and grass. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Taste has notes of hops, citrus and some tropical fruits. Palate is easy and pleasant, though it holds a certain zing. Overall a nice IPA which hold quite a punch for being a single IPA. Recommended.

Pours apricot low white head
Aromas of pineapple, peach, citrus
Taste has pineapple, peach, resin pine. Brilliantly balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2015 Growler. A hazy golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, straw, citrus fruit , and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, citrus fruitd, and hops, leasing to a bitter finish.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is crisp hoppy, grapefruity and light pine. Smooth fruity. Crisp hoppy. Citrusy and bitter. Lingering smooth fruity finish.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Pours hazy apricot with low white head. Aroma of mango, peach, citrus, so brilliantly balanced! Taste is incredibly balanced fruit and honey sweet with light fruit tart and mellow honey sour finish. Crisp, light body with soft carbonation. One of the most balanced beers I've had.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy amber colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and caramel with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and pine needles with notes of caramel and citrus.
Dry hoppy finish.

Tap @ Hill Farmstead. Cloudy straw, large white head. Aromas of pine and citrus. Taste is bitter and semi dry. Flavors is a pine and citrus combo. Finish is dry and piney with a touch of straw. Another stunning brew.

Flip-top received in trade. Thank you! Pours hazy vibrant deep yellow with a frothy white head that leaves lots of sticky spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity, grassy and slightly herbal with crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple, unripe mango, freshly cut grass, pine needles, white grape skins, diesel fuel, cantaloupe melon, lemon balm, orange zest and lemon zest. Taste is bitter, fruity, slightly herbal and slightly herbal with crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple, mango, lychee, wild strawberries, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon balm, black pepper corns, minerals, white grape skins, orange zest and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter, fruity and slightly herbal with crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple, lychee, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon balm, chives, orange zest and lemon zest. Dank, fruity and basically a perfect IPA!

(Bottle) Pours hazy yellow golden to orange with an off-white. The aroma holds pine, grapefruit, tangerines, black pepper alongside some tropical fruit and red berries. Perfect pale, cracker-like malt profile. Extremely clean nose. The flavour is dry, medium to heavily bitter and tiny acidic. Citrus, pine and dry tropical fruits. Slim malt profile. The mouthfeel is tight and clean yet soft with a medium carbonation. Just perfect. Near medium bodied.

Growler, thanks to Alex and Pontus. Hoppy pine apple aroma, peach, passion fruit, earthy, caramel, oranges, very nice fruity bitterness, grapes, hay, some lychee fruit. Hoppy pepper flavor, citrus, pine, hay, pine apples, mango, melon, peach, diesel, floral, citrus, caramel notes. Hoppy citrus finish with hay, black pepper, peach, diesel and pine. Very clean, very tasty.

Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, lots of hops. Sweat, pine, big tropical fruits, pineapple, mango and apricot. Bitter hoppy flavour, light malts, lots of hops. Finish hops, malts, citrus and apricot. Nice!!
(From 75cL growler -7 days old, quite spectacular- @ Antwerp Gettogether Tasting. Shared by digita7693, LoPo87 and Sam. Thanks a million!!)
Bottle. Yellow pour with tan head. Citrus, tropical, grassy, herbal hop aromas. Full citrus and fruit hops, grassy and herbal flavors.
Draft. Pours gold white head. Nose and taste of citrus, grapefruit, grass, cracker malt. Medium body.
On tap at pro pig. Hazy orange with head and lace. Pungent orange spicy hop aroma. Medium fruity sweet orange with orange spicy hop dry bitterness. Effervescent medium body. Excellent.
Growler thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy gold with medium white frothy head. The aroma is floral hop and pine. Thin mouthfeel with nice pine, resin and citrus. Easy to drink, very nice.

Big bursting aroma of tangerine, touch of grapefruit, tiny bits of pine, hay hitting me before I can even take a look. Brilliant, slightly hazy pink grapefruit, golden color with a rocky head of white foam. medium to light medium body with slightly soft carbonic feel. Balanced in all directions, a touch sour in the finish finish. Shockingly delicious. Very strange.

Two day old growler from the source. Cloudy brown orange with a perky white head. Nose is orange pith, grass and faint mango. Medium body with refreshing carb, finishing resiny. Taste is orange marmalade, toffee, grass and mild pine. Lovely balance. Amps up the session qualities.

Growler courtesy of and shared with Kermis, big thanks.
Thin white head. Lovely citrus/pine aroma. Clousy golden blond pour. Lovely citrus bitterness. A beautiful IPA

Growler courtesy of Kermis. Poured a hazy light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is big pine needle, grassy hop and loads of fresh citrus fruit. The flavour is medium to light bitter with a smooth light refreshing zesty citrus, woody, light pepper palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Quite a light beer but with lots going on. Track this down if you can. I was lucky to get a taste!

Very graciously shared by Kermis. Poured slightly hazy orange amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of sweet citrus, cream and light caramel malt. Medium body, smooth, flavour of vanilla, orange, grapefruit. Lightly bittersweet finish.

Growler, courtesy of kermis. Pours a hazy golden beer with a nice soapy off white head on top. Aroma has massive pine, grapefruit, light malty backbone. Some light herbal essences in there or something. Flavor is moderately bitter, nice fresh mouthfeel. Light carbonated, light malty in the background. Nice and very smooth drinking experience, very easy to drink this. Massive thanks for sharing this rare gem.

Growler shared. Pours hazy dark golden with an off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, pine, orange peel, really fresh resinous hops. Flavour is light sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Excellent!

Growler pour. Awesome. Incredibly fresh on the nose. Citrus and fresh cut grass. Light but well balanced. Lightly hoppy.

Growler from HF. Pours a hazy golden honey with a medium white head. Aroma of fresh hops, lemongrass, pine and mild grapefruit. Taste of lemongrass, grapefruit, pine and hops. Crisp and refreshing. Another spectacular IPA from HF.

750ml growler drank on january 2013, two and a half week old and on tap at the brewery. Huge pop at the opening, this one was nicely sealed. Intencing danky aroma of onion and weed, some citrus and leaf. This feels like the small cousin of Abner, less powerful but more drinkable. One of my favourite favourite IPA.

Sample courtesy of dak. It pours with a hop hazed heavenly deep gold body that supports a nearly bright white head of foam. Growler. Super-dank nose of pine, pineapple, alfalfa, and light lemon. Pours a slightly cloudy light lemon-juice color. A surprisingly refined taste of pine, bitter lemon, a hint of ammonia, and a moderate hoppiness (as opposed to the heavy aroma). Astringent, prickly mouthfeel with a dry finish. Delicious.

Growler: Thanks, Alex! Murky, cloudy, deep & burnt yellow body with a soap-like, foamy, stark white head that rests softly on tap & leaves a nice sheet of lacing behind. Aroma full of juicy citrus notes, orange & grapefruit rinds, light weediness, dripping hop oils, mild resin, & a light hint of white pepper. Just a juicy, gushing IPA that explodes with citrus & raw hop abrasion. Taste follows along; super-dry IPA style with grapefruit rind & orange zest bashing your tongue up front, followed by softer notes of warm hop leaves, freshly cut grass, white pepper, just a hint of cracker malt sugar for good measure. Juicy, citrus finish with a little leftover hop oil on the palate. This is an amazing IPA that I could crush all day.
Hazy yellow/apricot pour with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, dank and tropical fruit aroma with a flavor of nice citrus hop bitterness and a nice dry finish. Nice complexity.

Growler thanks to Mike. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Mild onion and grassy hop aromas. Grass and floral hop notes. Almost unbalanced, but with just enough of a caramel malt backbone to keep her honest. Above average body and mouthfeel.
Hazy yellow pour with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, dank and tropical fruit aroma with a flavor of nice citrus bitterness and a nice dry finish. Very good.
Cloudy yellowish/apricot pour, white head. Love the hops. Dank and cat pee, some tropical fruit, lightly bitter, citrusy finish. Wow this is really really damn good. Lives up to the hype.

750 ml growler thx Heather and Frank A: grapefruit, tropical fruits app: hazy pale white head t/p: light body with moderate long finish o: excellent. Nose is amazing . a threat for the hophead like me.

750 ml growler. Thanks Tom! Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a big foamy head that fades normally to a nice thick ring. Aromas are big juicy grapefruit and tropical fruit hops along with peaches and a very light caramel malt scent. Taste is more peachy than the aroma. Still a good amount of grapefruit, pineapple, and mango. Medium body. Mouthfeel has perfect carabonation and a little oiliness. Very good IPA. And just like their other hoppy beers, so easy to drink.

Growler, 04/04/2014. Pours hazy orange, rocky white head with great retention, sticky soapy lacing clinging to the glass as it dies down. Aroma is juicy citrus and tropical hops - tangerine essence, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, maybe even a bit of peach - with clean biscuity caramel malts underlying. Taste is pineapple, orange citrus, and pulpy grapefruit, touch of sweet caramel malts, light toast character. Light body, yet round creamy. Really nice.
A very clean, lightly grassy ipa with hints of grapefruit. Not really getting the stone fruit character from this one that others have mentioned, but a good beer nonetheless.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a hazy orange color with a medium white head that dissipates gradually to a film. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of grapefruit, hops, pine and malt. Light to medium body with flavors of zesty citrus, resiny hops and toasted malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering citrusy hops aftertaste. Good IPA all around.

Draft. Pours murky orange with thick white head that lingers. Citrus grapefruit aroma with medium carbonation. Nice hop flavors, not over bearing with some complexity.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2014 Draught at Three Penny Tap Room, 3/15/14Rosy-amber colored body has a light haziness to it and a firm white head that is well-retained.Incredibly aromatic nose is bursting with soft, juicy, bright hops. Tons of juicy tropical fruit notes (mango, peach, lychee, pineapple) and a perfect amount of balancing malt sweetness (light pale malt sugars). Wonderfully fragrant and 100% free of pine sap, resin, alcohol or citrus rind-like astringency. Very clean, as well.Flavor is equally devoid of any pine-like astringency. Acids never build up on the palate, leaving only delicious, light, yet vibrant hop flavors on the palate; ruby red grapefruit, mango, lime, lychee...Malt is lightly sweet giving your basic honey-like flavors.  Carbonation is fairly engaging, though there was a touch of wateriness in the beer and I could actually see it benefiting from a little more attenuation.  I honestly love the relative lack of bitterness here.  I wish more IPAs were like that.  I do, however, feel that in turn, the beer needs to be pretty near bone-dry when there arent as many bittering hops to balance the malts.
Taster at the source. Pours pale white gold with a big lingering white head. Aromas of grapefruit, tropical fruit. Taste is smooth and big on grapefruit hop. Nice.

Pour is a hazed golden amber with a bubbly white head. Nose is powerful citrus and grapefruit hops. Subtle grain notes and a hint of a malt backbone. Taste is so gentle and focused, tropical fruits everywhere, mango, grapefruit, peach skin. Light grain notes. Bitterness is present through the finish with a fairly inviting palate, extremely soft body, crisp clean finish, tropical fruits gently linger. This stuff is darn good.

Not fair that you have to drive to the boondocks for this one. Its like going on a pilgrimage, a trek into the vast wilderness for the golden elixir. Its worth it though. This is the best IPA Ive ever had, and Ive had enough to know. Wish they would distribute just a little more south.

750 ml growler. Pours a cloudy orangeish pale golden with a resilient, thick, creamy white head. Aroma is lemon and various citrus. Flavor is fruity (orange, mango, peach, pear, lemon, grapefruit, lime, NAME IT), yeast and white bread. Finish is very bitter, flavorful as crap citrus hops, as well as spruce and cedar. Lingering fruits all over my buds. Medium body, mellow mouthfeel, average to strong carbonation. Most excellent!
Growler thanks to Mads. Cloudy golden. Big and absolutely delicious hop aroma of orange, pine and tropical fruit. Dry, hoppy flavour. Id be sooo drunk if I had access to this on tap...

75cl growler. Pours hazy orange With a small White head and lacings. Very bitter and dry nose and flavor. Flowers, grapefruit, lemon and pine. Also some juicy fruit chewing gum. Crisp and bitter finish. Smooth With a perfect level of carbonation. Genius.
750 Growler huge thanks to Dany. Yellow orange cloudy pour. Lots of citrius in the nose. Perfect blend of citrius and bitter. Very crisp. This is an excellent single ipa.
Pours light orange from growler. Orange zest citrus aroma. Light crisp hippy taste. Perfect bitter balance

Another nice hill farmstead ipa. Hazy orange pour. Lots of orange, pineapple, and fresh hops in the nose. Light bitterness with a soft biscuit base. More orange flavor, peach, grapefruit, grass. Smooth and buttery finish. Dry, drinkable, and nicely carbonated. Great!

Growler shared by Ed, huge thanks man! Pours out a lightly cloudy golden color with a small off white head. Aroma is of juicy citrus fruits, light tropical notes, pine hops and some soft light bread. growler, golden orange pour, tropical fruits, cat pee, piney hops. medium to fuller mouthfeel. another winner from HF

First tasted while waiting in line at the brewery, then shared twice more from fresh growlers. A deeper richer golden yellow than the pale ales sharing the lineup, same haziness, same gorgeous head. The hop profile shows a greater tropical fruit presence, with a sweetness the is more melon than papaya, matched to grapefruit and guava. No oiliness, just clean bright hop character ending in bitterness of decent but not overwhelming length. Once again, the beauty lies in the malt balance. This IPA did not forge new territory in a tactile or flavour sense, but it did demonstrate how perfect balance can create a new awareness and a greater clarity of what an IPA should be, as opposed to just showing up as another hop bomb. Beautiful, but to be honest, I am more in awe of the three pale ales I had (Edward, Walden, and Neldon).

In short: A kickass aromatic pale IPA.  That simple.
How: Growler 750ml, consumed fresh a few hours after purchase at the brewery.
The look: Cloudy amber-orange body topped by a medium white head with medium retention and leaving lots of lacings on the glass.
In long: The highly aromatic nose is a pure bouquet of tropical fruits over a bed of flowers.  Taste has the typical Hill Farmstead IPA malt backbone, full, bready, crackery, light notes of soft caramel  This one seems to be using a bit more caramel malts than many of their single-ipa lineup (almost zero caramel in those) but a bit less than in their flagship Edward.  Hopping is dominant but never aggressive, lots of tropical fruits, nice floral character, some grapefruits, light coniferous notes.  This is once again HF being HF, pushing strong in the aromas department, keeping it simple, focus on high drinkability more than high intensity.  This one is near the top of their kick-ass IPA lineup.  If I had to choose between world peace and an unlimited supply of Hill Farmstead Id be faced with a difficult dilemma, start each day with an Hill Farmstead IPA or with a Hill Farmstead Saison?
